title: Grant Thornton: Strategic Analysis
text:
Overview
For our Business Strategy group project,we all had to work in teams of six and act as business consultants and assess a company based on their strategic advantages, resources/capabilities and possible weaknesses.This project was year-long and followed four key stages of strategy consulting: Orientation, Diagnostics, Intervention, and Evaluation
My group chose Grant Thornton as I have previous experience from working for the firm, and felt my experience and knowledge of this firm would be invaluable to the group.
View Full strategy Here


Strategic Highlights

Competition: Competing for brand recognition against the Big Four.
Technology: Investing in AI, automation, and data analytics to stay competitive.
Workforce: Emphasizing culture, career development, and talent retention.
Client Relations: Strengthening trust and insights through client retention.
Sustainability: Expanding ESG services to meet market expectations.



Diagnostics Summary

Opportunities: Expand advisory services and sustainability consulting.
Threats: Big Four competition and regulatory changes.
Strengths: Global presence, tech investments, personalized services.
Weaknesses: Lagging ESG initiatives and talent development challenges.



Key Recommendations

Define KPIs for market expansion.
Introduce cross-functional teams and RPA.
Enhance employee training and stakeholder engagement.
Strengthen ESG leadership and analytics capabilities.



Conclusion
Grant Thornton’s focus on mid-market specialization, innovation, and ESG leadership positions it well for sustainable growth and differentiation in the professional services market.

title: Aquaband Defender
text:
Aquaband Defender Prototype




Aquaband Defender is a GPS-enabled safety band designed to prevent water accidents among children and water hobbyists. This project has undertaken a concept paper, feasiblity study, marketing analysis and a presentation for Dragon’s Den.





Raise water safety awareness
Launch in Irish market targeting parents and water enthusiasts
Achieve first-year sales of 2,500+ units












Market segmentation strategy
Financial projections (€395,000 in first-year revenue)
Marketing and promotional tactics






 View Full PDF Report

title: About
text:
Hello my name is Liam Cummins, I am a final year studient at Dublin City University (DCU), where I am currently pursuing a, undergraduate degree in Business Studies. Before pursuing this course I had completed a two-year Post Leaving Certificate (PLC) course in Business Management at Coláiste Dhúlaigh College of Further Education. I’ve found my plc to be vital in helping my educational development, specifically in growing my confidence and building a foundation of business knowledge I can apply to the workforce or for further progression.
With the necessary education qualifications, from Coláiste Dhúlaigh, I was offered direct entry into Year 2 of DCU’s Business Studies course. From then on I have completed year 2, conducted an internship with Grant Thornton as part of my year 3, and am on track to graduate year 4, with a chosen specialisim on Data Analytics.

Before pursuing this course I had completed a two-year Post Leaving Certificate (PLC) course in Business Management at Coláiste Dhúlaigh College of Further Education. I’ve found my plc to be vital in helping my educational development, specifically in growing my confidence and building a foundation of business knowledge I can apply to the workforce or for further progression.
With the necessary education qualifications, from Coláiste Dhúlaigh, I was offered direct entry into Year 2 of DCU’s Business Studies course. From then on I have completed year 2, conducted an internship with Grant Thornton as part of my year 3, and am on track to graduate year 4, with a chosen specialisim on Data Analytics.

title: About
text:
Professional Experience

Finance Intern – Grant Thornton Ireland
During my internship at Grant Thornton, I worked in the FAAS (Financial Accounting and Advisory Services) department. I was assigned to two international teams: SEI US and State Street US.
My responsibilities included: - Preparing and reviewing second-level funds. - Assisting with fund accounting and compliance checks. - Ensuring timely and accurate documentation for reviewers. - Collaborating with team members across different regions.
This experience helped me develop a strong attention to detail, reinforced my ability to work under pressure, and allowed me to gain real-world exposure to large-scale financial operations. It also introduced me to the importance of client-focused work, deadline management, and the importance of teamwork in professional environments.
Most importantly, my time at Grant Thornton helped solidify my passion for roles that blend finance, strategy, and analytics — and I was grateful to form long-lasting connections with mentors and peers during the placement.

title: About
text:
Skills & Interests

Coding : Python (Pandas, Matplotlib), SQL, Excel
Reporting & Communication: Financial reporting, presentation design, collaborative team environments
Other Interests: Business innovation, marketing strategy, financial technologies, and sustainability in business

title: About
text:
Career Goals
As I approach graduation, I’m actively exploring graduate roles in marketing, business analytics, or procurement. I’m excited to bring my academic learning, technical skills, and real-world experience to a dynamic organisation where I can contribute to growth, solve problems creatively, and continue developing as a professional.
In the long term, after I have gain enough valuable experience in the business world, I aim to become an entrepreneur and start my own company that will use business innovation to help the disadvantaged in Ireland and hopefully expand worldwide.

title: Bank Loan Approval – Machine Learning Models
text:
Project Overview
I developed and evaluated machine learning models to predict loan approvals using applicant financial and demographic data.
The goal was to identify patterns that predict whether an applicant would be approved for a bank loan. View full assingment Here

title: Bank Loan Approval – Machine Learning Models
text:
Models Built

Random Forest Classifier
Decision Tree Classifier
Logistic Regression
Support Vector Machine (SVM)

title: Bank Loan Approval – Machine Learning Models
text:
Key takeaways

Random Forest delivered the best overall performance.
Logistic Regression served as a simple and interpretable baseline.
SVM struggled due to dataset characteristics.
Visualizations helped identify misclassifications and improve understanding of model behaviour.

title: Reflection
text:
From completing these various projects for this portfolio, I have found it to be a very informative and reflective experience. By utilizing Quarto and Github pages, I was able to effectively write and display my project. I developed practical skills in strategic business analysis, machine learning model building, and professional project presentation using Quarto and GitHub Pages.
Working on real-world scenarios, like the Grant Thornton strategy report and the Aquaband Defender marketing plan, helped me bridge the gap between academic theory and business application.
Additionally, building this ePortfolio strengthened my technical abilities in areas like website deployment, version control with Git, and data visualization — skills that are highly valuable in today’s digital economy.

title: Reflection
text:
From completing these various projects for this portfolio, I have found it to be a very informative and reflective experience. By utilizing Quarto and Github pages, I was able to effectively write and display my project. I developed practical skills in strategic business analysis, machine learning model building, and professional project presentation using Quarto and GitHub Pages.
Working on real-world scenarios, like the Grant Thornton strategy report and the Aquaband Defender marketing plan, helped me bridge the gap between academic theory and business application.
Additionally, building this ePortfolio strengthened my technical abilities in areas like website deployment, version control with Git, and data visualization — skills that are highly valuable in today’s digital economy.

title: Reflection
text:
Key Challenges

Translating Research into Recommendations:
Turning academic frameworks into actionable business strategies was more difficult than I initially expected. It required critical thinking and creativity to move beyond simply summarizing theories.
Balancing Technical and Academic Demands:
Managing coding tasks (Python modeling, visualizations) while ensuring the written reports met academic standards was challenging but rewarding.
It taught me the importance of project planning and time management.
Team Collaboration:
Particularly during the Grant Thornton group project, coordinating research, writing, and analysis with team members was a critical skill development opportunity.

title: Reflections on Web Design
text:
Skills Developed

Creating and configuring a Quarto project website.
Publishing live websites using GitHub Pages.
Applying basic HTML and CSS/SCSS for design improvements
Embedding multimedia content and customising layout.

title: Reflections on Web Design
text:
Future Improvements
If I had more time, I would explore: - Utilizing python and SQL in its relationship with Quarto to make more interactive pages. - Remember pitfalls from previous experience to be better equipt for the next project. - Consider implementing animation into the slides.

title: Reflections on Web Design
text:
Overall Reflection
Building this website gave me a deeper appreciation for digital presentation skills and project-based learning. It also taught me the importance of attention to detail, organization, and continuous testing when creating my own website porfolio.
This experience has strengthened my confidence in setting up and devloping authentic web pages, a skill I will carry forward into my future career development.

title: Reflections on Web Design
text:
Building this ePortfolio website, proved to be a lengthy assignment, but was a valuable and necessary experience to develop practical skills in web development, project organisation, and digital presentation.
This reflection focuses specifically on the process of creating, customizing, and deploying my site.

title: Reflection
text:
What’s Next?
As I move toward graduation, I am excited to pursue graduate opportunities in financial analysis, business strategy, or data-driven consulting.
The skills and experiences captured in this portfolio — from technical modeling to strategic thinking — will serve as a strong foundation for my professional career.
Building this portfolio also helped me realize the importance of lifelong learning, especially as technology continues to reshape the world of business.
I look forward to applying these skills in real-world settings, continuously improving, and contributing to organizations that value innovation, analysis, and strategic insight.
